{{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = Fallen Angels Vol 1 7.jpg | Name = Fallen Angels | Aliases = Angels | Status = | Identity = Secret | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = [[Beat Street Club]], [[Manhattan]], [[New York (State)|New York]]. | Leaders = Formerly [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]], [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]] | CurrentMembers = [[Bill the Lobster (Earth-616)|Bill]], [[Chance (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Chance]], [[Alphonsus Lefszycic (Earth-616)|Gomi]] | FormerMembers = [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]], [[Tabitha Smith (Earth-616)|Boom Boom]], [[Devil Dinosaur (Earth-78411)|Devil Dinosaur]], [[Don the Lobster (Earth-616)|Don]], [[James Madrox (Mutate Duplicate) (Earth-616)|Madrox Independent Dupe]], [[James Madrox (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|"Multiple Man"]], [[Moon-Boy (Earth-78411)|Moon Boy]], [[Roberto Da Costa (Earth-616)|Sunspot]], [[Theresa Cassidy (Earth-616)|Siryn]], [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]], [[Warlock (Technarch) (Earth-616)|Warlock]] | Allies = | Enemies = [[Unipar (Earth-616)|Unipar]] and [[Coconut Grove]] | Origin = A gang of adolescent thieves organized by the [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]], later turned by the alien [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]] as a mutant collection for scientific study for [[Coconut Grove]]'s purpose. | PlaceOfFormation = | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Jo Duffy; Kerry Gammill | First = X-Factor Vol 1 12 | First2 = {{g|Mentioned; Unnamed; [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]] & [[Tabitha Smith (Earth-616)|Boom Boom]]}}
{{sld|Fallen Angels #1}}{{g|First appearance of [[Chance (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Chance]]}}
{{sld|Fallen Angels #2}}{{1stfull}} | Last = Fallen Angels #8 | HistoryText = The Fallen Angels was a group of superhuman individuals, primarily made up of adolescent [[Homo Superior|mutants]], that was based at the Beat Street Club in [[Manhattan]], [[New York (State)|New York]].{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 2}} The group began as a gang of adolescent thieves organized by the adult mutant criminal the [[Vanisher]].{{r|X-Factor Vol 1 12}} Among his recruits were the young mutant [[Tabitha Smith (Earth-616)|Boom Boom]], the cyborg [[Alphonsus Lefszycic (Earth-616)|Gomi]] and his two cybernetically-enhanced lobsters [[Bill the Lobster (Earth-616)|Bill]] and [[Don the Lobster (Earth-616)|Don]], a runaway named [[Chance (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Chance]], who did not know she herself was a superhuman mutant, and a young female named [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]], who, unknown to the Vanisher, was actually an extraterrestrial from a planet she calls the [[Coconut Grove]].{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 2|3}} In reality, Ariel was the driving force behind the group, as she had been secretly assigned by the government of her home planet to gather a collection of superhuman mutants for her planet's scientists to study.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 4}} She had used Chance as an accomplice to this end, not realizing that Chance was a mutant herself.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 6}} On his side, the Vanisher was only intending to gather a group of thieves to supply him and to live comfortably without working. He was scared to death from the mutants-hunters teams such as [[X-Factor (Earth-616)|X-Factor]] or the [[Marauders (Earth-616)|Marauders]].{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 8}} After accidentally injuring his teammate [[Samuel Guthrie (Earth-616)|Cannonball]], a deeply ashamed [[Roberto Da Costa (Earth-616)|Sunspot]] left his own team, the [[New Mutants (Earth-616)|New Mutants]], and ran away to the city, with his teammate [[Warlock (Technarch) (Earth-616)|Warlock]] accompanying him, trying to keep him from harm. They encountered Chance, who led them to the Fallen Angels, and the two were invited to join.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 1}} Associates of the New Mutants, [[Theresa Cassidy (Earth-616)|Siryn]] and the [[James Madrox (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Multiple Man]], secretly a rogue duplicate of the main [[James Madrox (Earth-616)|Jamie Madrox]], were asked to follow Sunspot, and they soon encountered and joined the group as well.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 2}} Some time later, secretly following up on stories she had heard, Ariel took the group to [[Earth-78411]], where they encountered and befriended extra-dimensional mutants [[Devil Dinosaur (Earth-78411)|Devil Dinosaur]] and [[Moon-Boy (Earth-78411)|Moon Boy]].{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 4}} Another [[James Madrox (Mutate Duplicate) (Earth-616)|Madrox Duplicate]] from the Fallen Angels' Madrox joined the team later, but refuse to rejoin the "original".{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 5}} It was revealed both by [[Mini-Cerebro]] and the fact to having not been vanished during Madrox's powers nullifying by Chance that he was a mutated duplicated, a mutation of a mutation.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 6}} Finally, the Fallen Angels journeyed to Ariel's home planet, after [[Chance (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Chance]]'s powers endangered the team, nullifying the peace-mutation of Warlock, and making the Vanisher believe he was targeted by some mutants-hunter, and allowing Ariel to teleport them, pretendly for their safety, herself unbeknownst of the source of the disturbances.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 6}} There, they were made captives. Ariel turned against her home planet's ruler Unipar when he took not only her friend Chance but also Ariel herself captive as well, since they both proved to possess superhuman mutant powers. The Fallen Angels regained their freedom and returned to Earth, but the [[James Madrox (Mutate Duplicate) (Earth-616)|mutated duplicate]] was reabsorbed by [[James Madrox (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|"the real Madrox"]].{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 7|8}} Sunspot and Warlock returned to the New Mutants, and eventually Siryn and Multiple Man returned to their base at the [[Muir Island]] research facility. Boom Boom left to become inducted as a trainee of the original mutant team [[X-Factor (Earth-616)|X-Factor]]. Moon Boy and Devil returned to their homeworld, while Vanisher returned to crime. Ariel eventually resurfaced after [[M-Day]] in [[San Francisco]], while Chance's subsequent fate remains unrevealed. [[James Madrox (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|"Multiple Man"]] later allied with [[Nathaniel Essex (Earth-616)|Mr. Sinister]] into his [[Nasty Boys (Earth-616)|Nasty Boys]], and briefly absorbed the original [[James Madrox (Earth-616)|James Madrox]], using his adventure in the Fallen Angels to make the new [[X-Factor (Government) (Earth-616)|X-Factor]] and even Madrox himself believe he was the original.{{r|Fallen Angels Vol 1 8}}{{r|X-Factor Annual Vol 1 8}}{{r|X-Factor Vol 1 75}} | Equipment = [[Mini-Cerebro]] | Transportation = [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]] and [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]] (for his own purpose) teleportation powers. | Weapons = | Notes = In her plot to assemble a pool of [[Homo superior|mutant beings]], [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]] had collected various kind of specimens: * [[Vanisher (Earth-616)|Vanisher]], [[Roberto Da Costa (Earth-616)|Sunspot]], [[Theresa Cassidy (Earth-616)|Siryn]], [[Tabitha Smith (Earth-616)|Boom Boom]]: Classic '''Human mutants''', or '' '''[[Homo superior]]''' '' ** [[James Madrox (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|"Multiple Man"]], a '''[[James Madrox (Earth-616)#Powers|duplicate]]''' from [[James Madrox (Earth-616)|Madrox]] *** An '''independent [[James Madrox (Earth-616)#Powers|duplicate]]''': [[James Madrox (Mutate Duplicate) (Earth-616)|Madrox Independent Dupe]], from a [[Homo superior#Secondary Mutation|Secondary Mutation]] or for being a [[Mutate]]. ** [[Chance (Fallen Angels) (Earth-616)|Chance]], a [[Homo superior#Latent Mutant|'''latent mutant''']]. * [[Homo Superior#Non-Human [[Warlock (Technarch) (Earth-616)|Warlock]] ** A '''[[Coconut Grove]] mutant''': [[Ariel (Coconut Grove) (Earth-616)|Ariel]], herself, first mutant of her species. | Trivia = | Links = }}
